body.p:
To his Excellency Beriah Magoffin
Govenor of the Commonweath of Kentucky.

We the undersigned citizens of Caldwell County Kentucky have long known Thomas B Wadlington & he has ever been considered a good & true hearted citizen, Known & noted for his industry & orderly conduct. The dificulty in which he was engaged with Milton A Cartright did not appear to be of his seeking, nor are we satisfied that the case was presented to the Jury as it really occurred. We hope your excellency will reviw the case & give the poor man the benefit of every doubt. we desire that his case may be judged in mercy & regarded with favor. We hope that your excellency will take into consideration every circumstance that ought to opperate in his behalf. And we desire that your excellency may & will be persuaded that it is consistent with your duty to extend to him Executive Clemency & that his life life may be spaired, either by granting him a full pardon or by a commutation of his punish
-- punishment.
